metadata.title: CVE-2010-3702 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Gfx::getPos function in the PDF parser in xpdf before 3.02pl5, poppler0.8.7 and possibly other versions up to 0.15.1, CUPS, kdegraphics, andpossibly other products allows context-dependent attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) via unknown vectors that trigger an uninitializedpointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-12ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler68 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-12ubuntu1').
poppler package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.16.0-0ubuntu2').
ipe package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
